channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Multiple potholes that are now a foot and more wide, rapidly deteriorating road. Cars swerving to avoid them are narrowly missing parked cars. Accident will happen soon., 10th March
item.description:
From 267 Priors Road down towards Oakley, over half mile.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 265, Priors Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole in middle of road, 10th March
item.description:
Pothole is difficult for cars to avoid and could possibly be fixed at the same time as the (similar) one in Lypiatt Street that I reported a few weeks ago.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 46;47, Tivoli Street, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Verges churned up (by recent roadworks), 10th March
item.description:
I couldn’t really find a category for this, but residents have been reporting the impact of recent roadworks around The Park - particularly between the junctions of Grafton Road to Moorend Park Road, and beyond. The verges have been churned up by the heavy vehicles and are particularly muddy. Please could you confirm if there will be a process of “making good”? Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Park, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: 2 blocked drains on Battledown side of London Rd, 10th March
item.description:
There are 2 blocked drains on the Battledown side of the London Rd - 1 close to the Sixways junction and 1 between 286 London Rd and Sandhurst Place. Drains further down the hill are able to drain water so it appears to be a problem specific to these 2 drains rather than the system as a whole being overwhelmed by the quantity of water.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 284, London Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pittville Crescent Lane, Marle Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Large pothole and smaller one., 10th March
item.description:
2 pot holes again in the same area it appears as last ones reported in Feb 24. Just after 50mph zone, before corner. Unable to see them in rain or dark and unavoidable without going over to other side of road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Traffic lights at Hucclecote Rd and Churchdown Lane crossroads are changing too quickly, 10th March
item.description:
Traffic lights at Hucclecote Rd/Carrisbrook Rd/Churchdown Lane crossroad are changing too quickly, causing unnecessary tailbacks back into Hucclecote village.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote Road, Hucclecote, Gloucester

item.title: Split sections of tarmac near centre of highway creating serious trip hazard In Old Brockhampton Lane, Winchcombe., 10th March
item.description:
I have located the section of the road on the plan and it can also be located by what3words second. spirit.chariots. This is not a pothole rather the road surface has heaved up over several years causing the tarmac split into a series of fractures running broadly along the centre of the highway. Old Brockhampton Lane is a quiet, no-through-country road serving only a limited number of properties. There is no pavement so pedestrians walk along the road. One person has already fallen and injured themselves. It is a popular walking route linking to numerous footpaths. Please level and resurface this section of road asap.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Brockhampton Road, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic lights timings fault, 10th March
item.description:
Traffic light for right turn into Greenways is activating when there is not vehicle waiting to turn (which is not the sequence). Lights are remaining on red for too long for cars travelling towards Hucclecote making it impossible to turn right onto main road from junctions further up Barnwood Road. Timings need restoring to their normal sequences as traffic queue is bad on Sunday and will be a big problem on Monday morning.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greenways, Barnwood, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Traffic light timing on letting 6 vehicles at a time through, 10th March
item.description:
When traveling from Hucclecote towards Brockworth the timing of the lights is only letting about 6 vehicles through. This has caused tailbacks as far as Notley Place and this is on a Sunday!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Carisbrooke Road, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: H Line not repainted after road resurfaced, 10th March
item.description:
Dropped kerb to wide gravel driveway - numbers 55 and 57 Gretton road. H Line not repainted after road resurfacing works. Please reinstate this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gretton Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
